headline: Bank earnings, retail sales, SCOTUS tariff ruling: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Wednesday, January 14, including earnings results from major banks Citigroup (C), Wells Fargo (WFC), and Bank of America (BAC); the latest print on US retail sales data from November; and the US Supreme Court's (SCOTUS) expected ruling on President Trump's tariff policies. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: JPMorgan Stock Rises After Sharp Drop on Earnings. What Spooked Markets.
summary: JPMorgan Chase  stock was showing signs of recovery in Wednesday‚Äôs premarket following a sharp fall the previous session on disappointing fourth-quarter results.  While the bank‚Äôs adjusted earnings beat analysts‚Äô estimates, profits fell 7% from a year earlier on the back of lower-than-expected investment banking fees.  The banking giant had to set up a $2.2 billion credit reserve as part of agreeing to buy the iPhone maker‚Äôs card portfolio.

content.title: JPMorgan Stock Rises After Sharp Drop on Earnings. What Spooked Markets.
content.summary: JPMorgan Chase  stock was showing signs of recovery in Wednesday‚Äôs premarket following a sharp fall the previous session on disappointing fourth-quarter results.  While the bank‚Äôs adjusted earnings beat analysts‚Äô estimates, profits fell 7% from a year earlier on the back of lower-than-expected investment banking fees.  The banking giant had to set up a $2.2 billion credit reserve as part of agreeing to buy the iPhone maker‚Äôs card portfolio.

headline: Bank of America‚Äôs Profit Climbs as Consumer Spending Rises
summary: Bank of America  said its profit rose 12% in the fourth quarter of last year,  as consumer spending rose and delinquencies on credit cards edged lower.  The bank said spending on debit and credit cards rose 6%, while delinquencies of over 90 days on credit cards fell to 1.27% versus 1.35% a year ago.  ‚ÄúWith consumers and businesses proving resilient, as well as the regulatory environment and tax and trade policies coming into sharper focus, we expect further economic growth in the year ahead,‚Äù CEO  Brian Moynihan  said in a press release.

content.title: Bank of America‚Äôs Profit Climbs as Consumer Spending Rises
content.summary: Bank of America  said its profit rose 12% in the fourth quarter of last year,  as consumer spending rose and delinquencies on credit cards edged lower.  The bank said spending on debit and credit cards rose 6%, while delinquencies of over 90 days on credit cards fell to 1.27% versus 1.35% a year ago.  ‚ÄúWith consumers and businesses proving resilient, as well as the regulatory environment and tax and trade policies coming into sharper focus, we expect further economic growth in the year ahead,‚Äù CEO  Brian Moynihan  said in a press release.

headline: Bank of America Tops Estimates on Equity Trading Boost
summary: Bank of America saw revenue from equity trading rise 23% to $2.02 billion and net interest income topped analysts' estimates as traders posted a strong fourth quarter. Dani Burger reports on Bloomberg Television.

content.title: Bank of America Tops Estimates on Equity Trading Boost

headline: BofA Tops Estimates as Trading Beats and Lending Revenue Rises
summary: Revenue from equity trading rose 23% to $2.02 billion in the final three months of the year, according to a statement Wednesday.  Analysts had been expecting equity-markets revenue of close to $1.9 billion.

content.title: BofA Tops Estimates as Trading Beats and Lending Revenue Rises
content.summary: Revenue from equity trading rose 23% to $2.02 billion in the final three months of the year, according to a statement Wednesday.  Analysts had been expecting equity-markets revenue of close to $1.9 billion.

summary: Financial services giant Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market‚Äôs revenue expectations, with sales up 6.5% year on year to $28.37 billion. Its GAAP profit of $0.98 per share was 2.2% above analysts‚Äô consensus estimates.

headline: Bank of America Profit Climbs 12% as Earnings Top Estimates
summary: Bank of America reported fourth-quarter profit that rose 12% to $7.6 billion from a year ago.  On a per-share basis, earnings were 98 cents, topping the 96 cents that analysts expected.  Bank of America‚Äôs shares rose 1.4% in premarket trading.

content.title: Bank of America Profit Climbs 12% as Earnings Top Estimates
content.summary: Bank of America reported fourth-quarter profit that rose 12% to $7.6 billion from a year ago.  On a per-share basis, earnings were 98 cents, topping the 96 cents that analysts expected.  Bank of America‚Äôs shares rose 1.4% in premarket trading.

headline: Wells Fargo is having an 'identity crisis,' strategist says
summary: Wells Fargo (WFC) stock is falling in Wednesday's pre-market trading after reporting its fourth quarter results ‚Äî alongside Bank of America (BAC) and Citigroup (C) ‚Äî with the bank's revenue falling short of Wall Street's adjusted earnings and revenue estimates. Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre and Threadneedle Ventures founder Ann Berry discuss Wells Fargo's fourth quarter release, noting how severance expenses dragged down the bank's figures. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

Wells Fargo (WFC) stock is falling in Wednesday's pre-market trading after reporting its fourth quarter results ‚Äî alongside Bank of America (BAC) and Citigroup (C) ‚Äî with the bank's revenue falling short of Wall Street's adjusted earnings and revenue estimates.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more¬†Morning Brief.

headline: Bank of America Expects Net Interest Income Growth in 2026
summary: Bank of America said it expects net interest income, a core revenue source, to grow between 5% and 7% on a fully tax-equivalent basis in 2026.  The bank said it expects net interest income on that basis to rise 7% in the first quarter.  The first quarter includes two fewer days of interest accrual, Bank of America noted.

content.title: Bank of America Expects Net Interest Income Growth in 2026
content.summary: Bank of America said it expects net interest income, a core revenue source, to grow between 5% and 7% on a fully tax-equivalent basis in 2026.  The bank said it expects net interest income on that basis to rise 7% in the first quarter.  The first quarter includes two fewer days of interest accrual, Bank of America noted.

headline: Bank earnings, commodities gains, retail sales & PPI: 3 Things
summary: Big Bank stocks Wells Fargo (WFC), Citigroup (C), and Bank of America (BAC) released their fourth quarter earnings results this morning. US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) fall in Wednesday's pre-market trading, while oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) continue to tick back up and gold (GC=F) and silver (SI=F) climb to new record highs. US retail sales topped expectations for November, while December's Producer Price Index (PPI) inflation reading came out hotter than expected. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Bank sell-off is more about valuation than earnings performances
summary: Bank stocks slid lower in Wednesday's session after Wells Fargo (WFC), Citigroup (C), Bank of America (BAC), and JPMorgan Chase (JPM) reported their latest earnings results this week. Morgan Stanley (MS) and Goldman Sachs (GS) also tick lower ahead of their earnings releases due out on Thursday. S&P Global Market Intelligence director of financial institutions research Nathan Stovall addresses the valuation concerns tied to the banking sector that may be dragging the financial sector down despite generally strong results. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Big Banks‚Äô Bad Day: Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Citi Sink Most in Months
summary: Shares of some of the largest U.S. banks logged their steepest declines in several months after the lenders reported fourth-quarter earnings that fell short of investors‚Äô high expectations.  Investors found things to like about the reports from Citigroup, Bank of America, and Wells Fargo, such as solid measures of credit quality and positive commentary from executives across the three firms about their investment banking pipelines.  Citigroup stock fell 3.3% to $112.41, its largest decline since October 2025, according to Dow Jones Market Data, while shares of Bank of America fell 3.8% to $52.48, their largest drop since April 2025.

content.title: Big Banks‚Äô Bad Day: Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Citi Sink Most in Months
content.summary: Shares of some of the largest U.S. banks logged their steepest declines in several months after the lenders reported fourth-quarter earnings that fell short of investors‚Äô high expectations.  Investors found things to like about the reports from Citigroup, Bank of America, and Wells Fargo, such as solid measures of credit quality and positive commentary from executives across the three firms about their investment banking pipelines.  Citigroup stock fell 3.3% to $112.41, its largest decline since October 2025, according to Dow Jones Market Data, while shares of Bank of America fell 3.8% to $52.48, their largest drop since April 2025.
